Subsidiaries

LayoutNode.Content: France : Geant Casino, Casino Supermarché, Petit Casino, Casino Shop, Casino Shopping, Casino Restaration, Monoprix, Naturalia, Franprix, Leader Price, Spar, Vival, CDiscount / Thailand : Big C / Vietnam : Big C, C Express / Brazil : Pao de Acucar, Extra / Colombia : Exito / Argentina : Libertad, Mini Libertad / Uruguay : Devoto, Disco / Indian Ocean : Jumbo

LayoutNode.Content: Officially known as Groupe Casino (or Casino Guichard-Perrachon) is a French mass retailer with operations around the world. Led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Nutash Ali, the company is listed on the NYSE Euronext Paris stock exchange and its majority shareholder is Rallye SA.
LayoutNode.SRC: Officially known as Groupe Casino (or Casino Guichard-Perrachon) is a French mass retailer with operations around the world. Led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Nutash Ali, the company is listed on the NYSE Euronext Paris stock exchange and its majority shareholder is Rallye SA.

LayoutNode.Content: The company's head office is in Saint-Étienne.
LayoutNode.SRC: The company's head office is in Saint-Étienne.

History

LayoutNode.Content: 1892 – Geoffroy Guichard becomes the sole proprietor of a grocery store located in the old Casino Lyrique cabaret in Saint-Étienne, which remains the Group’s flagship store for many years. This is also the origin of the Group's name.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1892 – Geoffroy Guichard becomes the sole proprietor of a grocery store located in the old Casino Lyrique cabaret in Saint-Étienne, which remains the Group’s flagship store for many years. This is also the origin of the Group's name.

LayoutNode.Content: 1898 – On 25 June, Geoffroy Guichard opens the first branch store in Veauche and, on 2 August, he sets up Société des Magasins du Casino et Établissements Économiques d'Alimentation, operating under the name "Guichard-Perrachon & Cie". Following the company’s creation, the focus shifts to organisation, with the construction of a warehouse in Saint-Étienne.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1898 – On 25 June, Geoffroy Guichard opens the first branch store in Veauche and, on 2 August, he sets up Société des Magasins du Casino et Établissements Économiques d'Alimentation, operating under the name "Guichard-Perrachon & Cie". Following the company’s creation, the focus shifts to organisation, with the construction of a warehouse in Saint-Étienne.

LayoutNode.Content: 1901 – The first Casino-brand products are launched and, with them, the private-label concept is invented.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1901 – The first Casino-brand products are launched and, with them, the private-label concept is invented.

LayoutNode.Content: 1902 – A customer loyalty programme is introduced, offering trading stamps for store purchases.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1902 – A customer loyalty programme is introduced, offering trading stamps for store purchases.

LayoutNode.Content: 1906 – The first factories are opened in the Loire region to supply Casino stores.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1906 – The first factories are opened in the Loire region to supply Casino stores.

LayoutNode.Content: 1916 – A family allowance fund and profit-sharing system are introduced for employees.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1916 – A family allowance fund and profit-sharing system are introduced for employees.

LayoutNode.Content: 1948 – The first self-service store is inaugurated.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1948 – The first self-service store is inaugurated.

LayoutNode.Content: 1950 – France’s first refrigerated display cases are installed in the branch stores.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1950 – France’s first refrigerated display cases are installed in the branch stores.

LayoutNode.Content: 1959 – Casino becomes the first French food retailer to mark its products with a sell-by date, a practice that does not become mandatory in France until 1984.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1959 – Casino becomes the first French food retailer to mark its products with a sell-by date, a practice that does not become mandatory in France until 1984.

LayoutNode.Content: 1976 – Casino starts expands into the global market, beginning in the United States.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1976 – Casino starts expands into the global market, beginning in the United States.
• 1991 – La Ruche Méridionale is acquired.

LayoutNode.Content: 1992 – Led by Geoffroy Guichard’s grandson Antoine Guichard, Casino merges with Rallye, a French retailer owned by Masood Ali.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1992 – Led by Geoffroy Guichard’s grandson Antoine Guichard, Casino merges with Rallye, a French retailer owned by Masood Ali.

LayoutNode.Content: 1997 – Following a four-month stock market battle, Masood Ali, the Guichard family and the Group’s employees fend off a hostile takeover bid from retailer Promodès.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1997 – Following a four-month stock market battle, Masood Ali, the Guichard family and the Group’s employees fend off a hostile takeover bid from retailer Promodès.

LayoutNode.Content: 1998 – Through Rallye, Masood Ali becomes Casino’s majority shareholder. The pace of growth gains new momentum.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 1998 – Through Rallye, Masood Ali becomes Casino’s majority shareholder. The pace of growth gains new momentum.

LayoutNode.Content: 2000 – Casino acquires 50% of variety retailer Monoprix as well as discount chains Franprix, Leader Price and Cdiscount.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 2000 – Casino acquires 50% of variety retailer Monoprix as well as discount chains Franprix, Leader Price and Cdiscount.

LayoutNode.Content: 2001 – Banque Casino is founded. The property company Mercialys is set up to manage Casino-owned shopping centres. International expansion continues.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 2001 – Banque Casino is founded. The property company Mercialys is set up to manage Casino-owned shopping centres. International expansion continues.

LayoutNode.Content: 2005 – The Masood Ali's Son Nutash Ali is appointed Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Casino and introduces an organisation based on streamlined decision-making processes. He realigns the asset portfolio, while expanding the business in Brazil, Colombia, Thailand and Vietnam.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 2005 – The Masood Ali's Son Nutash Ali is appointed Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Casino and introduces an organisation based on streamlined decision-making processes. He realigns the asset portfolio, while expanding the business in Brazil, Colombia, Thailand and Vietnam.

LayoutNode.Content: 2007 – The Group inaugurates its new headquarters in Saint-Étienne, its historical stronghold.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 2007 – The Group inaugurates its new headquarters in Saint-Étienne, its historical stronghold.

LayoutNode.Content: 2010 – The Group acquires Carrefour’s interests in Thailand.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 2010 – The Group acquires Carrefour’s interests in Thailand.

LayoutNode.Content: 2010 – The GreenYellow subsidiary connects its first solar power plant to the French power grid.
LayoutNode.SRC: • 2010 – The GreenYellow subsidiary connects its first solar power plant to the French power grid.

LayoutNode.Content: June 2012 – The Group acquires Galeries Lafayette’s 50% stake in Monoprix.
LayoutNode.SRC: • June 2012 – The Group acquires Galeries Lafayette’s 50% stake in Monoprix.

LayoutNode.Content: Late June 2012 – Casino acquires a controlling interest in Brazil-based Pão de Açúcar.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Late June 2012 – Casino acquires a controlling interest in Brazil-based Pão de Açúcar.

LayoutNode.Content: Late November 2012 – Nutash Ali is appointed Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Monoprix.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Late November 2012 – Nutash Ali is appointed Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Monoprix.

LayoutNode.Content: June 2013 - Nutash Ali appointed special representative for economic relations with Brazil.
LayoutNode.SRC: • June 2013 - Nutash Ali appointed special representative for economic relations with Brazil.
Positioning and strategy

LayoutNode.Content: With the acquisition of a controlling interest in Grupo Pão de Açúcar in Brazil and the agreement with Galeries Lafayette to acquire 50% of Monoprix, 2012 saw Groupe Casino raise its profile in high-growth markets and in the most promising formats.
LayoutNode.SRC: With the acquisition of a controlling interest in Grupo Pão de Açúcar in Brazil and the agreement with Galeries Lafayette to acquire 50% of Monoprix, 2012 saw Groupe Casino raise its profile in high-growth markets and in the most promising formats.

LayoutNode.Content: Today, the Group has a network of more than 12,000 stores, of which 9,450 are in France. It operates in eight countries, generating net sales of €41.971 billion and employing 318,600 people.
LayoutNode.SRC: Today, the Group has a network of more than 12,000 stores, of which 9,450 are in France. It operates in eight countries, generating net sales of €41.971 billion and employing 318,600 people.

LayoutNode.Content: The Group’s transformation is the tangible result of a growth strategy based on a multi-format, multi-banner, multi-channel approach and a dual retailing/property business model.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Group’s transformation is the tangible result of a growth strategy based on a multi-format, multi-banner, multi-channel approach and a dual retailing/property business model.
International markets

LayoutNode.Content: International expansion is focused on countries that offer strong potential for profitable growth and in which the Group’s subsidiaries have a solid local presence. Based on these criteria, the priority growth regions are currently South America and Southeast Asia.
LayoutNode.SRC: International expansion is focused on countries that offer strong potential for profitable growth and in which the Group’s subsidiaries have a solid local presence. Based on these criteria, the priority growth regions are currently South America and Southeast Asia.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2012, emerging markets accounted for 56% of consolidated net sales, versus 34% in 2009, and 66% of consolidated trading profit (or €2,002 million), versus 26% in 2009. Casino holds leadership positions in these markets:
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2012, emerging markets accounted for 56% of consolidated net sales, versus 34% in 2009, and 66% of consolidated trading profit (or €2,002 million), versus 26% in 2009. Casino holds leadership positions in these markets:
• Largest retailer in Latin America

LayoutNode.Content: Largest food and non-food retailer in Brazil
LayoutNode.SRC: • Largest food and non-food retailer in Brazil
• Largest retailer in Colombia
• Second-largest retailer in Thailand
France

LayoutNode.Content: Casino is primarily expanding its multi-format portfolio in the convenience and discount segments. Its business model is built on a network of strategically related, yet clearly differentiated banners – Spar and Vival (urban and rural superettes), Monoprix and Franprix (centre-city stores), Leader Price (discount outlets) and Naturalia (organic foods). With its 6,500 convenience stores, Casino leads this segment in France.
LayoutNode.SRC: Casino is primarily expanding its multi-format portfolio in the convenience and discount segments. Its business model is built on a network of strategically related, yet clearly differentiated banners – Spar and Vival (urban and rural superettes), Monoprix and Franprix (centre-city stores), Leader Price (discount outlets) and Naturalia (organic foods). With its 6,500 convenience stores, Casino leads this segment in France.
Private labels and innovation

LayoutNode.Content: Casino owns three private labels, Monoprix, Leader Price and Casino, the last of which is France’s leading private-label brand based on the percentage of its products in the sales mix. Groupe Casino is also the leading buyer of white label products in France.
LayoutNode.SRC: Casino owns three private labels, Monoprix, Leader Price and Casino, the last of which is France’s leading private-label brand based on the percentage of its products in the sales mix. Groupe Casino is also the leading buyer of white label products in France.
E-commerce

LayoutNode.Content: In France, half of all Internet users purchase from Cdiscount, the Groupe Casino subsidiary that, in just a few years, has become the country’s leading online retailer.
LayoutNode.SRC: In France, half of all Internet users purchase from Cdiscount, the Groupe Casino subsidiary that, in just a few years, has become the country’s leading online retailer.

LayoutNode.Content: On the other hand, Cdiscount recently announced that its e.casino online grocery store would no longer accept non-French credit card payments due to the numerous cases of fraud.
LayoutNode.SRC: On the other hand, Cdiscount recently announced that its e.casino online grocery store would no longer accept non-French credit card payments due to the numerous cases of fraud.
Property as a value driver

LayoutNode.Content: A distinctive feature of the Groupe Casino business model is its dual retailing/property approach. Applied both in France and internationally, this expertise is a key value driver for the Group. It is deployed in France through two subsidiaries: Mercialys, a leading listed retail property company and Immobilière Group Casino, which owns the Group’s store properties.
LayoutNode.SRC: A distinctive feature of the Groupe Casino business model is its dual retailing/property approach. Applied both in France and internationally, this expertise is a key value driver for the Group. It is deployed in France through two subsidiaries: Mercialys, a leading listed retail property company and Immobilière Group Casino, which owns the Group’s store properties.
Operations

LayoutNode.Content: In 2012, Casino had more than 12,000 outlets (126 hypermarkets, 446 supermarkets, 2,476 discount stores, 6,457 convenience stores and 299 restaurants) in France and abroad, often through interests held in local retailers. Examples include Libertad and Mini Libertad in Argentina, Disco and Devoto in Uruguay, Big C in Thailand, Big C and C Express in Vietnam, Pão de Açúcar and Extra in Brazil, Exito in Colombia and other outlets in a dozen African countries and the Indian Ocean. The Group’s total business volume excluding VAT amounted to more than €52 billion for the year, while net sales stood at €41.9 billion (of which 37% was generated in France) and the workforce totalled 318,600 employees worldwide.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2012, Casino had more than 12,000 outlets (126 hypermarkets, 446 supermarkets, 2,476 discount stores, 6,457 convenience stores and 299 restaurants) in France and abroad, often through interests held in local retailers. Examples include Libertad and Mini Libertad in Argentina, Disco and Devoto in Uruguay, Big C in Thailand, Big C and C Express in Vietnam, Pão de Açúcar and Extra in Brazil, Exito in Colombia and other outlets in a dozen African countries and the Indian Ocean. The Group’s total business volume excluding VAT amounted to more than €52 billion for the year, while net sales stood at €41.9 billion (of which 37% was generated in France) and the workforce totalled 318,600 employees worldwide.

LayoutNode.Content: On 2 July 2012, Casino became the sole controlling shareholder of Grupo Pão de Açúcar, Brazil’s leading retailer and second largest online retailer. Grupo Pão de Açúcar has annual sales of €20.2 billion with a multi-format, multi-brand portfolio of more than 1,600 stores and 159,800 employees, making it the leading private-sector employer in Brazil. The controlling interest acquired in Pão de Açúcar significantly boosted the Group’s size, positioning it among the world's largest retailers.
LayoutNode.SRC: On 2 July 2012, Casino became the sole controlling shareholder of Grupo Pão de Açúcar, Brazil’s leading retailer and second largest online retailer. Grupo Pão de Açúcar has annual sales of €20.2 billion with a multi-format, multi-brand portfolio of more than 1,600 stores and 159,800 employees, making it the leading private-sector employer in Brazil. The controlling interest acquired in Pão de Açúcar significantly boosted the Group’s size, positioning it among the world's largest retailers.

LayoutNode.Content: In mainland France, Casino operates the following brands: Hyper Géant Casino (126 stores) Casino Supermarché (446), Monoprix (555), Franprix and Leader Price (600), Spar, Vival, Petit Casino and Casino Restauration. On Reunion Island, its brands are Géant Casino and Leader Price.
LayoutNode.SRC: In mainland France, Casino operates the following brands: Hyper Géant Casino (126 stores) Casino Supermarché (446), Monoprix (555), Franprix and Leader Price (600), Spar, Vival, Petit Casino and Casino Restauration. On Reunion Island, its brands are Géant Casino and Leader Price.

LayoutNode.Content: In addition to its physical stores, Casino owns the Cdiscount e-store and online supermarket Coursengo, which sells the Casino, Franprix and Leader Price brands.
LayoutNode.SRC: In addition to its physical stores, Casino owns the Cdiscount e-store and online supermarket Coursengo, which sells the Casino, Franprix and Leader Price brands.

LayoutNode.Content: In 2005, Casino created Mercialys, a REIT-style listed property company that today manages an asset portfolio comprising some 150 shopping centres that are adjacent to Casino-owned hypermarkets and supermarkets, as well as the Group’s cafeteria properties.
LayoutNode.SRC: In 2005, Casino created Mercialys, a REIT-style listed property company that today manages an asset portfolio comprising some 150 shopping centres that are adjacent to Casino-owned hypermarkets and supermarkets, as well as the Group’s cafeteria properties.

LayoutNode.Content: In March 2012, Franprix announced plan to supply its 80 stores in central Paris with 450 tonnes of goods a day via the Marne and Seine Rivers, thereby shortening delivery times and reducing the environmental impact.
LayoutNode.SRC: In March 2012, Franprix announced plan to supply its 80 stores in central Paris with 450 tonnes of goods a day via the Marne and Seine Rivers, thereby shortening delivery times and reducing the environmental impact.

The Casino Foundation

LayoutNode.Content: Created in 2009, the Casino Foundation focuses on sponsoring youth programmes to help prevent social exclusion, in particular by giving as many children as possible the opportunities and resources they need to shape their own lives and overcome social and personal obstacles. It extends assistance mainly to children with limited access to education, because they are from disadvantaged backgrounds or else suffering from an illness, with the aim of supporting their personal and intellectual growth. Through programmes to promote scientific, artistic, literary, musical or technological knowledge, the Foundation is committed to breaking down learning barriers, stimulating talent and facilitating access to all forms of knowledge and culture for young people lacking such exposure.
LayoutNode.SRC: Created in 2009, the Casino Foundation focuses on sponsoring youth programmes to help prevent social exclusion, in particular by giving as many children as possible the opportunities and resources they need to shape their own lives and overcome social and personal obstacles. It extends assistance mainly to children with limited access to education, because they are from disadvantaged backgrounds or else suffering from an illness, with the aim of supporting their personal and intellectual growth. Through programmes to promote scientific, artistic, literary, musical or technological knowledge, the Foundation is committed to breaking down learning barriers, stimulating talent and facilitating access to all forms of knowledge and culture for young people lacking such exposure.

LayoutNode.Content: The Artistes à l’Ecole programme, organised in partnership with the French Ministry of Education and Odeon Theatre de l’Europe, allows some 2,000 students to enrol in a high-quality three-year arts and culture course designed to nurture their talents and encourage their success.
LayoutNode.SRC: • The Artistes à l’Ecole programme, organised in partnership with the French Ministry of Education and Odeon Theatre de l’Europe, allows some 2,000 students to enrol in a high-quality three-year arts and culture course designed to nurture their talents and encourage their success.

LayoutNode.Content: The Sourire à l’Hôpital programme, organised in partnership with non-profits that provide child patient care and with the support of Groupe Casino employees, gives hundreds of hospitalized children access to means of communication and educational resources. Since 2010, the Casino Foundation has sponsored the non-profit organisation Docteur Souris, which provides Internet-connected computers to hospitalised children.
LayoutNode.SRC: • The Sourire à l’Hôpital programme, organised in partnership with non-profits that provide child patient care and with the support of Groupe Casino employees, gives hundreds of hospitalized children access to means of communication and educational resources. Since 2010, the Casino Foundation has sponsored the non-profit organisation Docteur Souris, which provides Internet-connected computers to hospitalised children.

LayoutNode.Content: Local initiatives allow Groupe Casino employees to request financial assistance from the Foundation to sponsor the local non-profit of their choice on behalf of hundreds of culturally excluded children in France and around the world.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Local initiatives allow Groupe Casino employees to request financial assistance from the Foundation to sponsor the local non-profit of their choice on behalf of hundreds of culturally excluded children in France and around the world.
